page.title: 02Mr.Charles Hyde
page.content: Mr.Hyde was born on December 8th 1885.He has lived in Wool all his life.He came to school to tell the children about his life here. Next to the school was a blacksmith's The carpenter's shop was next door to it.Milk was delivered by pony and trap Mr. Hyde had his first car in 1916.It was a Calthorpe two-seater.There was no driving test and no licence was needed.Headlights on the car were oil lamps. When he was a little boy he wore a sailor suit. There was no television,so instead he played card games like Happy Families. Wool village was not a quarter of its present size. There were houses in High Street, Spring Street and Duck Street only;the rest was fields. How Wool has changed over the years.
